column1: JK has this super vocals and super dance skills and he still has THE LOOK of a romcom main character. AND HIS ENERGY! I love his energy. (I'm so in love, help me haha)
RM can rap and sing and he makes my heart so warm with the Elton John part. I totally melt with his dimple smile.

We need to talk about JIMIN's vocals! I always had a thing for JIMIN's voice, but he has been singing with so much confidence, I love it even more now! (I don't even need to talk about his dance skills, right?)
JIN has blossomed lately. Of course he was always an important part of BTS, but I think he has been shining brighter.
V is so cool. I absolutely love his voice and his stage presence. He seems to have everything under control.
J-HOPE is already a sunshine, but when he sings so softly my heart feels so much joy. Oh, I love his white hair, it suits him. I love how his part mets SUGA's (SOPE <3).
SUGA is so cute, but when he sings the last ""don't need to talk the talk"", he is the cutest ever. I love soft SUGA (and I love badass SUGA as well haha love love love).

column4: I really love that Jo Insung didn't speak down to Harang like he was a baby. Some adults (even some who come onto ODG) have a tendency to speak simply, less expressions, easier questions, or even put on a different tone when they interact with the kids. There are situations when it may be appropriate, and it may even help the kids be at ease, but I just really love how Jo Insung put them both on equal footing and leaned into the social and emotional intelligence that Harang always displays.

column8: Guys, you write a LOT of comments about tattoos.  Okay, we get it.  Just understand that you cannot know all the information.  We won't get a tattoo in the future if we violate Jungkook's privacy.  BUT now it all looks like bullying because you write so many comments about it instead of supporting the dancers.  We made this video and dance three days after the music video came out because we really wanted to support our idols!  When you dance on the street, it really helps other people learn about a K-pop group.  We put in so much effort, but in the end we only get bullying.  Do you think it's okay?  I think Jungkook wouldn't want your comments to be so rude either. Why can't the work of other ARMYs be respected?  Iâ€™m very upset that people only want to notice the bad moments and donâ€™t appreciate other people's work.  We donâ€™t receive money for our hobby, we do it for YOU and BTS. Weâ€™re fans for many years ... and really love BTS, but we canâ€™t know ALL information
